---
title: "In-class Exercise 4"
author: "Jaya George"
date: "May 4,2024"
date-modified: "last-modified"
execute: 
  eval: true
  echo: true
  warning: false
  freeze: true
---

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse,ggstatsplot)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
exam <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")
```
:::


**Parametric**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(1234)

gghistostats(
  data = exam,
  x = ENGLISH,
  type = "parametric",
  test.value = 60,
  bin.args = list(color="black",
                  fill="grey50",
                  alpha=0.7),
  normal.curve=FALSE,
  normal.curve.args=list(linewidth=2),
  xlab = "English scores"
)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


**Non-Parametric:**

Median is used here instead of mean.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(1234)

gghistostats(
  data = exam,
  x = ENGLISH,
  type = "np",
  test.value = 60,
  bin.args = list(color="black",
                  fill="grey50",
                  alpha=0.7),
  normal.curve=FALSE,
  normal.curve.args=list(linewidth=2),
  xlab = "English scores"
)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


**Extracting out the stat details**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(1234)

p<-gghistostats(
  data = exam,
  x = ENGLISH,
  type = "np",
  test.value = 60,
  bin.args = list(color="black",
                  fill="grey50",
                  alpha=0.7),
  normal.curve=FALSE,
  normal.curve.args=list(linewidth=2),
  xlab = "English scores"
)
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
extract_stats(p)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

:::
:::


**Robust:**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(1234)

gghistostats(
  data = exam,
  x = ENGLISH,
  type = "robust",
  test.value = 60,
  bin.args = list(color="black",
                  fill="grey50",
                  alpha=0.7),
  normal.curve=FALSE,
  normal.curve.args=list(linewidth=2),
  xlab = "English scores"
)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


**Bayes:**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(1234)

gghistostats(
  data = exam,
  x = ENGLISH,
  type = "bayes",
  test.value = 60,
  bin.args = list(color="black",
                  fill="grey50",
                  alpha=0.7),
  normal.curve=FALSE,
  normal.curve.args=list(linewidth=2),
  xlab = "English scores"
)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


**Plot against normal distribution:**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(1234)

gghistostats(
  data = exam,
  x = ENGLISH,
  type = "bayes",
  test.value = 60,
  bin.args = list(color="black",
                  fill="grey50",
                  alpha=0.7),
  normal.curve=TRUE,
  normal.curve.args=list(linewidth=0.5),
  xlab = "English scores"
)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggdotplotstats(
  data = exam,
  x = ENGLISH,
  y = CLASS,
)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
exam_long<-exam %>%
  pivot_longer(
    cols=ENGLISH:SCIENCE,
    names_to="SUBJECT",
    values_to="SCORES") %>%
  filter(CLASS=="3A")
  
  
ggwithinstats(
  data = filter(exam_long,
                SUBJECT %in%
                  c("MATHS","SCIENCE")),
  x = SUBJECT,
  y = SCORES,
  type="p"
)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](In-class_Ex04_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
